Review.Titre: I emailed in July regarding my update
Review.Contenu: I emailed in July regarding my update, and have had no response.  I have purchased endnote 21, but am unable to sign into my online account as it does not recognize my credentials.I have used endnote for years, but may be looking for a more responsive program.

new versions are getting worst compared to old version with user friendly. There is no user friendly environment. Most people use this software to update references for publication and recent version and updates are getting useless and more confusing. we are buying software to get easy to use, not getting wasting our time to figure it out, what functions where.

Review.Titre: Way to long to learn how to use the…
Review.Contenu: Way to long to learn how to use the program when I type it should auto creat the endnote based on the subject.  I am having better luck with other AI programs.  Iam a sigle person that needs to push out critical documents.  There for my time is extremely limited.This has been the issue since I have bought the program!  Exemple even on this page you limit the time frame of experience!

Review.Titre: Is Endnote fabricating trustpilot data or what?
Review.Contenu: Endnote's website claims that it receives a 4.7/5 rating based on 1,026 reviews on Trustpilot. It is quite a surprise. So I came to here to find if there is anything I missed. Guess what, Trustpilot shows that Endnote only receives 94 reviews with a 3.6/5 rating. This is interesting.

Review.Titre: EndNote is not that user friendly
Review.Contenu: EndNote is not that user friendly. Initially, getting to know the various options had took a learning curve that was manageable. But I have not been able to use EndNote because it freezes, consistently. I open it, and an update prompt comes whlie the appplication itself never gets going. I don't know if it's too late to get a refund because the program simply does not work on my PC desktop. But I spent money on unused software.

Review.Titre: unable to sink endnote with word
Review.Contenu: I was unable to cink endnote 20 with word on my mac laptop. No service appeals available from endnote. Blogs on web see similar problem and solutions on web did not work. Most importantly, there seems to way to get help from endnote.will not buy again. Will switch myself and my laboratory to using Mandalay

Review.Titre: Why was my first purchase END NOTE, unacceptable for an upgrade? ?
Review.Contenu: I was not aware that I purchased a new edition of END NOTE.  More importantly, when I called, I was told that my old edition was unacceptable for an upgrade. So I would genuinely appreciate an email to explain what's going on with my account which I didn't know I had.

Review.Titre: Repeated problems with no meaningful customer service
Review.Contenu: I have had repeated problems with the program but have just given up trying to talk to official Endnote representatives.  The service I have received is very limited and poor--I got more help from just googling and finding other consumer responses.  I'm still struggling just to utilize the program. Outsourcing your consumer representatives is both offensive and ineffective.

Review.Titre: I was fine with the old version that…
Review.Contenu: I was fine with the old version that stopped working so I fork over $100+ for a newer version to get my library back and get a constant library conversion request on the Mac version. Poor product design and testing especially when you charge a premium to stay current.
Awful—almost unusable. Not user friendly at all. Doesn’t do what it should, which is to make your citations easily accessible in a logical manner.
After many years, it still lacks an android version. To be able to edit pdf from a tablet nowadays is a must, and competitors just give this possibility.

Review.Titre: Can't incorporate references from a paper
Review.Contenu: There is no way to incorporate references from existing papers. Your software should be able to find and source every reference on a written paper. It can't do anything of the sort--I least I couldn't find a way.

Review.Titre: EndNote has 2 major problems for me.
Review.Contenu: EndNote has 2 major problems for me.1) EndNote does not work smoothly with WordPerfect.2) New imports are hidden by formatted space within the EndNote window.

Review.Titre: Tech did not listen to me when I was…
Review.Contenu: Tech did not listen to me when I was attempting to tell him my problem. Problem was not fixed and continues.

Review.Titre: The widget to capture info from the…
Review.Contenu: The widget to capture info from the grey literature has never worked. Repeated requests for assistance were no answered.

Review.Titre: I am using a government-issued computer…
Review.Contenu: I am using a government-issued computer and my personal computer for the endnote. is there any way to log in to EndNote's own program? to automatically update link on each endonote?

Review.Titre: I think your program is not very user…
Review.Contenu: I think your program is not very user intuitive at all. I’m probably not renewing

Review.Titre: I have been unable to perform the most…
Review.Contenu: I have been unable to perform the most recent update. My application keeps stopping and not updating.
What an awful experience?As a mature student, I did not find the program user friendly, or intuitive ultimately, causing me to abandon it very dissatisfied and disappointed Angela Christie

Review.Titre: Spent the money and couldn't use the…
Review.Contenu: Spent the money and couldn't use the product.  Now I'm struggling to get a refund.

Review.Titre: I cannot figure out how to install my…
Review.Contenu: I cannot figure out how to install my purchase

Review.Titre: Issue not resolved- still not able to…
Review.Contenu: Issue not resolved- still not able to use the program that I purchased

Review.Titre: The issue has not been resolved
Review.Contenu: The issue has not been resolved. No response yet to my last update for the fix that did not work

Review.Titre: I much prefer the previous interface.

Review.Contenu: It is slow. Not user friendly . Makes my whole Mac slow.
I do not like endnote. It is not user friendly
The management of libraries is very confusing.  THe elimination of duplicates also leads to missing references and is very cumbersome.

New release (EndNote 21.0.1) has obvious bug in author lists, listing an extra author in several styles I use.  Used to work fine, now broken.  A fix is supposedly in the works, but we're almost 3 months past release.  A failure of your QC process.

I purchased EndNote20 on Feb 13, 2023, and approximately a week or two later, you sent me a message noting the new version (EndNote21) was being released; and that I should purchase it (preorder).  Not cool.  I should have been grandfathered into the new one since it was only a week later.  To that end, I have chosen not to use the product; it just sits on my computer.  I wish I could give a good review and possible constructive criticism of the product but... Disgruntled customer.

Meh. I write scientific manuscripts and grants for a living and have not used EndNote in over 20 years. Recently, I have started working with several large clients that use it. Frankly, it's the pits. It's overpriced, isn't compatible with OneDrive/the cloud, and is clunky when citing directly from your browser. As it's so expensive, it's baffling that free products such as Zotero and Mendeley are so much better in every way. I just spent $247 for the program and now I've got to spend another $150 or so to upgrade to a cloud-compatible version. It screws up my documents in sometimes inexplicable ways, in which even tech support can't figure out, costing me well over $1000 in lost time and work since downloading in Feb 2023. I'm not sure why large institutions go all in on EndNote, leaving employees/researchers stuck with a crummy tool that isn't user friendly. Stick to Zotero if you don't need to work in Word Online or Mendeley if you do.

Word locks up if you try to rearrange paragraphs that contain a quote and instant formatting is on. It does not find articles as it is advertised--iIt gets me to my university, then flips out. The program opens on its own, even when Word is not running.Too many bugs!

I still have yet to be able to transfer my EndNote6 library to EndNote20. The instructions provided on the website are unclear and insufficient. I'm frustrated that I will likely have to call customer service and speak to a technician on what was touted to be a seamless transfer process.

Software misformats some APA 7 references (ex. Multiple authors). This is inexcusable.It also is next to impossible to manually edit references that are misformatted without chaos ensuing (your software overrides user corrections).Software interface is very dated/awkward and does not integrate well with programs like Microsoft Word.

Review.Titre: Endnote often makes Word freeze up if a…
Review.Contenu: Endnote often makes Word freeze up if a cite is changed in the document prior to opening Endnote.  Very annoying.  I have to use Task Manger to hard stop Word whenever this occurs.

Review.Titre: I purchased the product without a guide of how-to.
Review.Contenu: I purchased the product in the beginning of my dissertation. I read about Endnote in one of my research books. I believe the product would work great for me if I had time and a teacher to show me how to maximize it for me. I did not have time to write and review how-to videos. I would say be sure you know how to use it before purchasing it.

Lacks IntuitionThis is not an intuitive piece of software. I consider myself fairly skilled at using new computer programs and this one is extraordinarily and unnecessarily complicated. The interface feels antiquated and clunky--many, many clicks to get anything done. I am required to use it for my academic program, but I hope the rest of you have the option to use a different program.
Document import not intuitive.Convoluted.I continue to use Mendeley and Zotero intuitively, simply and freely.Not sure why I paid for convolution?

Review.Titre: The desktop version for Mac crashes…
Review.Contenu: The desktop version for Mac crashes routinely. I gave up using it and only use the online version.

Review.Titre: Too expensive for the service offered.

Review.Contenu: Limited online storage. Recommend increasing online storage limitation.

Sound citation…better than a few others. But some references do not easily attach into Word. Much of the citation functions are not intuitive either. For those who have used the old ‘reference manager’ by Thomson Reuters…that was much more intuitive. Sometimes updates do not make things better. There is an annoying issue when saving multiple copies of endnote documents- you have to use cloud function otherwise it does not recognise the same document on a different device.

Review.Titre: The interface is as clunky online as it…
Review.Contenu: The interface is as clunky online as it is in the desktop app. Also, when it's so easy to just plug a DOI into a website and pull an article, or find similar articles using multiple free sources (e.g., research rabbit, elicit, google scholar) I do not find it worthwhile to use endnote for these purposes.

The interface is old and clunky—-and the importing of citations from the online database are just riddled with errors.  End note has a tough time with Chicago and online citations—-treats internet like it is 1997.  Please please please have a real researcher show you whats wrong.

Review.Titre: Useful, but frustrating to deal with Clarivate.
Review.Contenu: I find EndNote to be extremely useful, but the company seems to be getting greedy and is extremely unresponsive to user input. They capriciously take away features in new versions that were in older versions, like the ability to hide unused fields. Why would anyone take that away? Why can't I share certain libraries with other users, not just one library for everything? Etc. Etc.

Review.Titre: Improved but some features need to return
Review.Contenu: Drag and drop of PDF files is a fantastic addition. Overall user interface is good, but would prefer to maintain the ability to open the reference details window as a separate pop-out window, one that is not confined to being along side the reference library window. Makes it tedious to edit text, and some functions (i.e., change case) are missing.

Review.Titre: We still cannot get Endnote to function…
Review.Contenu: We still cannot get Endnote to function easily= to implant into the citing articles I write in Word in the requested format and font type and size

Review.Titre: Endnote: Meh. Not great nor helpful.
Review.Contenu: Endnote could stand an upgrade in customer service and training that is open to new users. This program is NOT intuitive at all. The customer rep I spoke to several times was not very helpful and I got the feeling, bored with his job. I got the feeling the online help assumed my (the client) has used this platform for years which is unfortunate because he wasted alot of my time. I use Endnote sparingly because I am not able to use it without going through hours worth of videos that sometimes address the issues I am struggling with but most of the time not. Endnote really needs to look into basic education for first time users and technicians that cater to this cohort.

Review.Titre: would prefer easier way to cut and…
Review.Contenu: would prefer easier way to cut and paste. ctr c ctrl v locks up my computer. when I do a search that has multiple references, if I can one reference, it goes to that reference spot as opposed to maintaining my search list

Evernote was constantly crashing. I had to do extensive research to find out how to fix it. Basically there was corrupted old Evernote files. Had to get a specific app to clean it. The point being that I have to do quite a bit of research to resolve this problem. Should I take that much work. I’ve never had to do that with any other program.
Software stalls/glitches frequently. Also, perfectly for journal citations but tends to have formatting problems for others such as websites, books, etc.

The responses addressed the general problem, but not the specific instance I experienced, In my case, only one Endnote reference was causing COM errors. I suspect it was because Word uses a special character for ' or -, and Endnote couldn't deal with it.  Allan

I owned EndNote back in the days of software delivered on CDs. The new version is cryptic, poorly documented and cumbersome, comparitively. I find the functionality being heavily tied to academic libraries/institutions exclusionary. As an independent researcher without academic ties, the whole subscription proved disappointing, a waste of time, and essentially a donation to the company. Not happy.

Review.Titre: Handy software, but three glitches need fixing
Review.Contenu: In recent versions of EndNote, I've encountered three glitches that need fixing.   First, when I click "Find Reference Updates", I can Update All Fields and Update Empty Fields, but I can no longer Edit Reference.  I can't copy & paste from the online information, and I can't type into my version of the reference.     Second, and related, I used to be able to delete a section in my version of the reference and then hit "Update Empty Fields" and continue editing, but now the program closes the whole window.   Third, if I'm searching for a reference, I used to be able to type in, say, an author's name, then hit the tab button to get to the next search field.  Now, however, the tab button takes me out of the search windows and into the list of references, which is inconvenient.   Thanks.

Review.Titre: This is overall an excellent product
Review.Contenu: This is overall an excellent product.  It really works.  However, some items that are used frequently are difficult to find in the menus.  For example, unformatting citations is done often and it should be located up front as a large button that is easy to find.  You seem to focus on correcting elements of the program that are rarely used and do not attend to usual operations challenges.

Review.Titre: ENDNOTE is good but room for improvement exists.
Review.Contenu: ENDNOTE can help organize thousands of references and conduct Boolean searches even within PDF files. The ability to FIND FULL TEXT works only about 50% of the time. There is no AI option to summarize content in one or more PDF files. CiteWhileYouWrite works ok with WORD, but annoying "bugs" exist.

Review.Titre: Ask the Users BEFORE changing program functionality
Review.Contenu: It would be nice if existing users of the product were queried prior to revisions of the product to see whether the inclusion or removal of a feature is desired. For instance, on older versions of the program, there was a thumbnail of attachments for any particular entry. This made it easy to see the quality of the attachment or whether there were multiple versions of the attachment tied to a particular entry.Another issue is the timeliness of corrections made during program updates. For example, I was one of the first people to download v21 of the program and immediately noted that you were no longer able to paste into the search window using mouse commands as was the case in prior versions (Cntl-V still works.) I immediately reported the issue to technical support. The update to version 21 was just released and the problem still exists. This should have been a straightforward fix, yet it was ignored.
Product could be better.  However and note corporate is not willing to listen to customer comments.

Review.Titre: I upgraded from several EN versions…
Review.Contenu: I upgraded from several EN versions back. It was a little awkward to get used to EN21, but now that I have, I can appreciate some new features such as its remarkable ability to grab online PDFs without going through the usual hassles. There are a couple of older features that I miss, though: I used to be able to see a quick preview of a new reference in my chosen output format on-screen, without having to write it to an output file. (Maybe I just haven't figured out how to do that yet.) Also, on the Edit page the top toolbar is missing the Greek symbol conversion that used to be there. Also, it would be really helpful to give us a couple of highlight colors like yellow and red in that toolbar!

Review.Titre: There's no replacement for EndNote when…
Review.Contenu: There's no replacement for EndNote when you want to inventory useful articles, find them again, and then footnote your paper. I have trouble syncing across Macs and also the pdf annotater is a bit limited compared to earlier EndNote versions. EndNote also sometimes corrupts my pdf's so I need to keep duplicates in a separate file. All in all, though, I couldn't live without the app.

I have been using EndNote since 1995. It was an inherently important part of my doctoral research. The ability to create multiple libraries was important. The ability to change format styles is very important as I present and publish papers in different venues. There as more features in EndNotes that I do not use, but I have not had the time to really did deep into the latest version.

Review.Titre: EndNote21 makes it easy to organize…
Review.Contenu: EndNote21 makes it easy to organize your references in a way that they can be searched and accessed efficiently.  However, their APA 7 style has some errors in it so you need to be mindful of that if you are going to use it.

I have had to request help for problems with EndNote on two occasions.  EndNote responded promptly, both times.  One problem had an easy fix that was suggested by email (and solved my problem), while my other problem was much more complicated.  For the complicated problem, someone scheduled an appointment to work with me within a few days.  The EndNote person was infinitely patient, knowledgeable and very helpful.  We probably spent 2½ hours working together.  Very thorough.  I was quite satisfied with the support, and EndNote personnel made it clear that they wanted to completely solve the problem.  It's not great to run into a problem, but it is good to know that excellent support is available from EndNote.  Thank you!

Excellent product, but… As it turned out, I needed to upgrade my Mac operating system before the new version of Endnote would run properly. That would have been ok, if the download or setup had checked for what OS I was running and advised me about the lack of backward compatibility.
Excellent customer service and support.  Good basic citation formatting, but some manual editing is still needed for APA 7 style.  Integration with library and data base search varies.

Review.Titre: It’s good but I have drop box that…
Review.Contenu: It’s good but I have drop box that opens anytime I open a word document.

Review.Titre: It can be clunky and frustrating…
Review.Contenu: It can be clunky and frustrating sometimes but it works.
The software works.  Lately I have had trouble syncing but that may be resolved - my IT people don't know why it resolved ....

Review.Titre: I am a long-term Endnote user
Review.Contenu: I am a long-term Endnote user, since at least 1985. Over the years the software has gotten increasingly complex and powerful.  Sometimes reaching past the understanding of this author.  However, I have never sought to change to another approach.  When this onerous job needs to be accomplished Endnote is up to the task, even when it requires multiple discussions with the software providers.

The new UI is good-looking. However, I hope that I can hide some fields on the literature information page. For example, if I do not need a tertiary author for a journal paper, I hope I can hide this field on the interface where I input the information for the paper. I remember I could do this in older versions by deleting the name of this field in the preference interface.

Review.Titre: The connection and ease with referring…
Review.Contenu: The connection and ease with referring between endnote and word document. However, it will be great to connect to other Microsoft product such as power points. Also, it will be great if endnote can create subgroup based on reference used in specific document!

I have been using Endnote for many many years now but just now bought my own subscription.I never faced as many problems with Endnote in the past as I di with this new version. It crashed on me few times and also gave me some trouble for which I had to go online and find solution.Additonally, with this version as well as the last, I always have trouble importing references from a pubmed-created file. I know how to work it now...BUT it is still frustrating !!
I felt the new Endnote version was a good product that didn't differ significantly in my use so far. I'm interested to see what it can do as I explore more.

Fairly easy to use, but a colleague is available to answer questions. It would be nice if you could keep a reference and simply change a chapter number rather than needing to type it all in as a separate reference.
still some glitches with search function and the fact that have to switch back to personal library from pubmed search to actually be able to cite

Review.Titre: It is not as refined as I had hoped
Review.Contenu: It is not as refined as I had hoped. It still has trouble connecting some of the libraries I use. I like how much information I can include in my citations, and how I can organize everything.

Review.Titre: Very helpful to have the PDF of the…
Review.Contenu: Very helpful to have the PDF of the paper available to easily review while working on a manuscript. Are the menu and platform features are sometimes challenging to figure out

I generally have been very happy with Endnote. The one thing that is annoying is that one often has to try twice to link a pdf to a reference. This has been a bug for quite some time and has yet to be fixed.
Better than prior version, yet, needs some improvements (to fix the bugs). Also big pricey
Costumer service is excellent, software is running smoothly and it is user-friendly.
Thanks for a great product. The only drawback is the check spelling function appears not to work.
Good, but the interface could be improved.
Solid, reliable product.

I am a doctoral student, and EndNote does everything I need to do as a reference manager. I use APA 7, and EndNote handles the citations and reference entries well. I find attaching a pdf copy of the article a useful feature.

Fast, reliable, effortless. I cannot say enough good things about EndNote which I have been using for many years and have a growing library of refs that only get easier to search, find, organize and embed into manuscripts.

Review.Titre: This software has been fantastic help…
Review.Contenu: This software has been fantastic help in updating my 1000 page textbook.  However I found a minor glitch in 2021 version whereby i cannot directly copy and past DOIs as in 2020 version and instead copy then use two key to paste.  It has been especially useful in using Google search then locating a reference then directly downloading the “cite” function.  I highly recommend it for anyone in academics

Review.Titre: Endnote is one of the most useful…
Review.Contenu: Endnote is one of the most useful research tools I've ever used.  I've been a user for more than a decade and am now successfully managing nearly 50,000 references on a variety of subjects.  I've even converted many of my old graduate-school 5x8 cards to EN references.  Love having all my notes fully searchable.

The solidity of use! EN gives me confidence in my notes and references. Especially, that they will be where I can  find them. EN is a vital part of my research. Here is an item on my wishlist: that typing in a new reference with a name and part of a title would generate websearch results and a  list of citation choices. Other, programs offer that convenience but are not integrated as well into WORD, etc.

Your people are (and always have been) honest, accurate, sympathetic and helpful.  They understand the panic of a writer on deadline whose software has just lost citations......  After 20 versions, I'm probably more understanding than some users, but you all rock.

Review.Titre: EndNote has been an outstanding bibliography software.
Review.Contenu: EndNote has been an outstanding bibliography software for me.  I have been able to search and incorporate appropriate references as I am writing.  Also, a lot of the original articles are readily available (PDF files).  The learning curve of using EndNote has not been that steep, and it has made my writing experience almost effortless.

Review.Titre: I really like to use EndNote
Review.Contenu: I really like to use EndNote. It's really easy when you work with it.But EndNote should have some different offers for researchers at affordable prices.

Recent upgrades were excellent. I had noticed a few setbacks that were corrected. For example, when I typed in a name and book and then went online to search, I had to type again. That was fixed. This saves me a lot of time. There are other features that I have not used yet. But I usually use the online search for adding sources. If I had a complaint, it would be the style sheets. If they could be more accurate, that would be nice. SBL style sheet is not up to speed. I appreciate the sheer number of these things being available, however. But when they are inaccurate, I have to go in and fix them myself. That is time consuming. But I love this product and have been using it for 25 years.

Review.Titre: The product has been part of my daily…
Review.Contenu: The product has been part of my daily life for almost 30 years.  Customer support I've used only a couple of times and always outstanding.

Review.Titre: I've used Endnote for years and the new…
Review.Contenu: I've used Endnote for years and the new version, Endnote 21, is the best ever!  I like the way PDF's are converted into references, and how easy it is to import, search, organize.  It's a step up from an already excellent product.

I had an issue with upgrading to EndNote 21 from a previous version. I did not install it correctly because I was unaware that I needed the old version's code to upgrade. The customer service rep was extremely helpful, walking me through the solution and ensuring that everything works perfectly. All customer service should be this good.

Review.Titre: Program is a must of you write manuscripts often
Review.Contenu: Several features make the program helpful, the most important is the ability to archive hundreds of PDF scientific papers as well as find papers that are open source and download with the reference! What I see as a challenge several actions require two or three steps and lack of adequate keyboard short cuts(this might be that I haven't sorted them yet. Another major challenge is the risk of corruption of you store the folder on a local or distant NAS.

With EndNote, I no longer need to carry printed papers with me anywhere anymore: all is there in the my personal library: authors, dates, summaries and full texts. Attaching an old paper to a reference in the library is a breeze. And creating groups, add papers to them are all the features that make it easy the retrieval of needed information at any time, online or offline. The flexibility of switching from one bibliography style to another is alone a reason for having EndNote as a tool in the toolbox for any technical writer. Online search from public databases using keywords, downloading the free papers, and ranging them in designated groups are straightforward and very helpful. EndNote has become an indispensable tool for me and for my work for more than 30 years.

I have been using EndNote for about 16 years now, and I cannot imagine life without it! When I got a new laptop, I thought I would have to buy a new subscription, then found out I can add a second device. I was out of town, but a call to customer service helped me get EndNote 21 installed on my laptop. So very helpful, thank you!

Review.Titre: It’s saves you time; just buy it :)
Review.Contenu: It’s a seamless experience that will save you time! I highly recommend it for people who write and use lots of references! I use it with the plug-in for Pages and streamlines my workflow, truly!
It got an immediate answer to a burning question, which will save me hours of work. Thank you!

Review.Titre: Let writing be a pleasure again, use Endnote
Review.Contenu: A great research tool makes writing a pleasure, not a chore. Stores all of my references and articles in one place that I can access anywhere in the world.
Clear and usable categories.  Helps me write my book.
Very good!  I was guided step by step and clearly guided to a solution.  Most helpful IT experience I have ever encountered.
Had great support for a problem related to synchronizing my files.  The customer care advisor was patient and pursued the problem in a very timely manner.
The experience was relatively painless. The app is more than worth the price, and they appear to have finally fixed the update process from within the application itself with this release.
I've used EndNote for many years and it continues to be my friend as I do technical writing.
Essential software! I use it on all of my papers.
EndNote is easy to use!  Very helpful in organizing my research.

Review.Titre: Thanks for fixing the problem with…
Review.Contenu: Thanks for fixing the problem with Cite-While-You-Write and Word 2016!
A very useful tool. I would like to see some of the glitches addressed more frequently. I rarely see updates.
Very nice tool. I recommend you uninstall EndNote 20 to have a seamless install of 21.

Review.Titre: Love the new look and interface
Review.Contenu: Love the new look and interface. I have not used all the features yet but love what I see so far.

Review.Titre: This has made research and technical…
Review.Contenu: This has made research and technical writing so much easier! I love how easy it is to import materials, or even enter a new reference. I really love the fact you can group projects together. This has been helpful when working on multiple projects. I do wish there was more of a “file” type system where you could archive research materials. Such as moving the various projects group to another file. Other than this more “accessory” feature, this program has been great!
References readily found and insertion availableCite while you write is user-friendly
Good options for references and content formatting. Responsive program, old glitches now fixed.

Review.Titre: EndNote is fabulous for capturing and…
Review.Contenu: EndNote is fabulous for capturing and then structuring your information for writing articles and books. The label, notes, and other fields give you a lot of flexibility to call up just the info you need when it comes time to write, so long as you've tagged your info. One downside is that EndNote periodically corrupts attached pdf files, so you lose highlighting and notes you've put in the pdf. I also wish EndNote, as in previous versions, allowed you to more flexibly organize your screen (boxes, dividers, etc.).
It was easy to upgrade. I have been using Endnote for 25 years and I find it saves me time and is reliable.

First, I was writing my first scientific papers without a computer, so formatting the citations and references was a huge pain and reviewers often found problems with commas or other punctuation.  Ugh.  I bought EndNote when it first came out back in the '80's and never looked back.  EndNote is a great program that makes organizing PDFs a snap, cite while you write, change formatting, etc.  The improvements over the years (e.g., clicking a button to get PDFs) have be the icing on the icing of a great cake.  I would like to have a greater proportion of PDFs "linkable" with a "click" although that probably has more to do with journals than with EndNote.  I really have no complaints!
Great program. I have been using it since the 1980s, and it is one of the tools that constantly open on my computer desktop.

Review.Titre: My use of EndNote is purely research
Review.Contenu: My use of EndNote is purely research; I do not use it for citations while writing or other potential uses. Nonetheless, the flexibility of the fields in EndNote allow me to integrate material from dozens of different types of source materials, making my writing more efficient and definitely less error-ridden.

Two of our recent papers, both with extensive references that were much easier to manipulate with EndNote. One paper has already been published in May of last year and another is currently in review. I would have dreaded keeping track of these references "by hand".George E. Davis, MD, FACP, FACG

Review.Titre: EndNote is essential to all I do as a…
Review.Contenu: EndNote is essential to all I do as a researcher. I love this product.
prompt,courteous and knowedgable. solved my problem immediately two different ways

Review.Titre: The tech that I had was VERY patient…
Review.Contenu: The tech that I had was VERY patient with me and my questions. He helped me resolve all my problems.

Review.Titre: I like the new view and it appears…The new EndNotes
Review.Contenu: I like the new view and it appears easier to use and integrate.
The tech was knowledgeable, patient and very helpful.  Date I have provided is a pure guess.

Review.Titre: I've used EndNote for many years
Review.Contenu: I've used EndNote for many years. Seamless integration with Microsoft Word and no hiccups sinking with EndNote Web.Finally, figured out a way, too, to cite book reviews.I was university professor for 37 years and taught undergraduate and graduate students how to use EndNote and how it saves time.

End Note is, so far, the best way to keep track of references and interesting papers for my line of research. It is easy to use and allows for a lot of information to be at hands length. I only use some basic features of it but it is good enough for me.

I have become dependent on EndNote for my dissertation as well as other academic writing. The reason for the 5 star rating is when I run into issues or bugs, I call, they answer and they help. That seems rare these days to get a person on the phone who listens, can diagnose what is going on and gets me back up and running again.

Review.Titre: EndNote is indispensable to my science writing career
Review.Contenu: I'm always writing reports on new subjects, with maybe a hundred citations each.  It's easy to import citations from PubMed (with the main complication due to lack of standardization on the journal end), to cite articles, generate footnotes or endnotes, format the bibliography, and edit all of this during the writing process.  My job would be pretty unbearable without EndNote.

Review.Titre: I works like it's supposed to
Review.Contenu: I works like it's supposed to and makes modifying references for different Journals easy.

Review.Titre: The technical assistance offered by Endnote is the best in the business!
Review.Contenu: The technical assistance from a very smart cadre of individuals has been exemplary. I am so pleased that they are there when I need help with various Endnote issues & questions. They are patient, kind, and professional. Keep up the great work. You set a high bar for all other companies!

Review.Titre: I’ve been using Endnote for almost 30…
Review.Contenu: I’ve been using Endnote for almost 30 years, it’s part of me at TH is point. I could not have published articles or a book without it. Customer service has been excellent. I’d recommend anyone in academia should start using the program early in their career.
Constancy of service improvements and product.

Basically, Endnote becomes my library and assistant.  It saves me days when working on a manuscript.  If I have to change journals of formats, it's a click away - not correcting every entry in a manuscript.  I've tried other solutions that are free - but you really do get what you pay for.

Review.Titre: Easy to use product and competent and…
Review.Contenu: Easy to use product and competent and available technical support staff.

The changes are all improvements. I can manage my sources more quickly and accurately now. I can have multiple libraries open simultaneously and importing citations is a breeze. I use EndNote daily and I could not have finished my forthcoming book on time without it.

Review.Titre: Very user friendly when placing order.
I have used EndNote for years
Review.Contenu: I have used EndNote for years.  My interests are around medical history and, particularly, the history of the American anesthesia business.  EndNote is the center of my research universe.  I could not have organized and developed my work without it.

Using Grammarly and Endnote made (me) from a person who seized up when assigned a research document or term paper to a person who had the ability to generate a 20 page term paper into a person who now thinks I could teach English,Respectfully,Brian L Nolen

Review.Titre: Endnote gives me a system for organizing everything I have read
Review.Contenu: Endnote gives me a system for organizing everything I have read.  I primarily use Endnote to store notes on each item, questions that I can ask my students, and links to the source document.  I also use Endnote to instantly create reading lists or bibliographies.  Because by Endnote database is automatically synced to the web, whether I work at home or my office I am always using the same information.  I recently upgraded to Endnote X20 which has additional advanced features, but to be honest, I don't use those features.

Review.Titre: Experience with EndNote and its support team
Review.Contenu: First, the program has been most useful to me and easy to use.  Secondly, I had some problems of my own doing that your help desk was very responsive to and helped me solve the problem (and not point out how dumb I was).  So everything has been prompt, courteous, and helpful.  Please note I have not gone back to check exactly when the interaction(s) took place: it happened a couple of times in the last couple of years.

I really like endnote.  I just published a book that I wrote using the program.  The ability to easily switch between publication styles (Chicago, APA, etc.) during the proposal process was really helpful.

The support was helpful and necessary. I thought I lost a large segment of my library, and they were able to restore it completely. I have over 1000 books in my library so the help was greatly appreciated.Thanks again!

Review.Titre: Easy learning curve and simplicity of…
Review.Contenu: Easy learning curve and simplicity of use.

Review.Titre: EndNote is very easy to use when I…
Review.Contenu: EndNote is very easy to use when I inserted citations. EndNote always helps me to work efficiently. Also, I can log my reading journey into Research Note.
Couldn't write up my research without Endnotes. Every university should instruct students in it's use. Surprisingly, they do not!
I have had a few inquiries on features, and the customer support has been amazing. It's nice to chat with someone quickly and easily on an issue. The program is useful and easy to use.

Review.Titre: Support is always there. if there is ever a problem I can find…
Review.Contenu: if there is ever a problem I can find solution on website. EN interfaces well in area of expertise and with colleagues. It does not interface with Zotero and I wish people would not fall the 'free' nature of Zotero. it sucks.
This software is a life saver - it does exactly if not more than what it says it does - giving you time to think about your manuscript while it handles the citation and references.

Review.Titre: EndNote has always been a simple
Review.Contenu: EndNote has always been a simple, straightforward pleasure to use, including the purchase, download and integration process

Review.Titre: Great way to track various scientific…
Review.Contenu: Great way to track various scientific journals and articles. It’s also easy table to integrate references, into a word document and adjust references as I’m moving around and edit text within my papers.

Review.Titre: Ease of use and fast for adding to library and organization
Review.Contenu: Ease of use and fast for adding to library and organization. Hands down, EndNote is >>>> better than refworks.
Doing great, slightly not user friendly though.
Easy to use (relatively)Saves so much time with formatting and I love the integration with MS Word.

Review.Titre: Endnote has been a game changer for me
Review.Contenu: Endnote has been a game changer for me. I have been able to write and publish 3 studies this year. The ease of using endnote makes the flow of writing effortless.

Review.Titre: Easy to use for publishing journal…
Review.Contenu: Easy to use for publishing journal articles and keeping track of the procedures used in the lab

Review.Titre: Makes my writing so much easier
Review.Contenu: Makes my writing so much easier. Papers, dissertation, articles. Outstanding!

EndNote is a quick and easy-to-use reference management software that simplifies the process of organizing and citing sources. With its user-friendly interface and comprehensive features, EndNote makes managing references effortless and seamless. Overall, it's a great tool for anyone looking to streamline their research and writing process.

Review.Titre: EndNote is so Easy to Use
Review.Contenu: I really love how easy I can add references to EndNote from Google Scholar and other online research websites.
Organizes my reference articles with a .pdf into categories so I can  find them quick and easy.

Review.Titre: It took a little bit to get used to it…
Review.Contenu: It took a little bit to get used to it and figure out how to cite as you go. Sometimes I have to change the type face and size because it randomly changes. But. I don't think I can write without Endnote now!
Good for keeping track of sources.
Great program to organize different research projects.

Review.Titre: It's a fantastic product and the techs…
Review.Contenu: It's a fantastic product and the techs are very knowledgeable and patient

Review.Titre: Daily researcher and need a reliable…
Review.Contenu: Daily researcher and need a reliable bibliographic search program.

Review.Titre: I had several problems and a call to…
Review.Contenu: I had several problems and a call to the service department solved the problem.  *****

Review.Titre: Easy to navigate and web learning tools…
Review.Contenu: Easy to navigate and web learning tools are amazing

Review.Titre: Very good and easy to use.  Easy to upload from PubMed.
Review.Contenu: Very good and easy to use.
Endnote 20 is powerful and reasonably easy to use.

Review.Titre: Quick response time and good resolution…
Review.Contenu: Quick response time and good resolution of issue
The problem was solved systematically and efficiently.

Review.Titre: It was very clear and things worked

Review.Contenu: Great resource for long reviews
We use what we have. It works well.
Easy to use, and would highly recommend it!
excellent product and customer service easier to create subgroups and change formatting of references.
